shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Sinodos (fols. 1ra-166vb) I-1) Statutes or Commandments (tǝʾǝzazat) of the Apostles (fols. 1ra-34vb, 164ra-166vb) I-2) Apostolic Canons: 54 canons (fols. 35ra-42va) I-3) Canons after the Ascension of Our Lord (fols. 43ra-47vb) I-4) Apostolic Canons: 81 ʾabṭǝlisat (n°1) (fols. 47vb-56rb) I-5) Canons of Simon the Canaanite (n°2) (fols. 56rb-63ra) I-6) Apostolic Canons: 81 canons (fols. 63ra-66vb) I-7) Apostolic Canons: 81 ʾabṭǝlisat (n°2) (fols. 66vb-74vb) I-8) Canons of Simon the Canaanite (n°1) (fols. 75ra-81va) I-9) Melkite Index (fols. 81va-82rb) I-10) Canons of the Council of Ancyra (fols. 82rb-85vb) I-11) Canons of the Council of Neocaesarea (fols. 85vb-87vb) I-12) Canons of the Council of Gangra (fols. 87vb-89rb) I-13) Canons of the Council of Sardica (fols. 89rb-91rb) I-14) Canons of the Council of Antioch (fols. 91va-95vb) I-15) Canons of the Council of Laodicea (fols. 95vb-102rb) I-16) Canons of the Council of Nicaea (20) (fols. 102va-106va) I-17) Canons of the Council of Nicaea (84) (fols. 106va-116vb) I-18) Discourse of the 318 Nicene Fathers on the Right Faith and on the Monastic Life (fols. 117ra-119rb) I-19) Letter of Peter to Clement (fols. 119rb-122vb) I-20) Interpretation of the Ten Commandments by John Chrysostom (fols. 122vb-128vb) I-21) Exposition and admonition on the role of Our Lord in our salvation (also called On the Essence of the Holy Trinity) (fols. 128vb-130va) I-22) Exposition and admonition on the way of virtue and perdition (also called How to Distinguish between God and Evil) (fols. 130va-131rb) I-23) Exposition and admonition on the fear of God (fols. 131rb-135ra) I-24) Exposition and admonition on not associating with Jews (also called On the Former People of God) (fols. 135ra-142rb) I-25) Exposition and admonition of Gregory of Armenia against the Jews (fols. 142rb-146rb) I-26) Exposition and admonition to believers on wise conduct (fols. 146va-155rb) I-27) Penitential canons given to St. Peter (fols. 155rb-160vb) I-28) Index of the Statutes or Commandments (tǝʾǝzazat) of the Apostles (fols. 161va-162vb)
Additio 1; colophon.

donors.donor: According to the colophon, the book was donated by qesä gäbäz Sәmʿon.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn. The boards and leaves are heavily affected by humidity and mould. The board attachment, sewing are damaged. The last three fols. are misplaced: fols. 164-165 should have been placed between fols. 1 and 2. Some fols. are heavily damaged, e.g. fols. 1, 161,165,166. Some fols. are damaged by water, e.g. fols. 1-9, 149-160. Tears carefully amended on fol. 74, 95, 100, 156.

bindings.binding: Two thick wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires (e.g. fols. 86v-87r), one close to the head, one close to the tail.

txquires.txquire: Due to the condition of the Ms., the structure of the quires cannot be established.

squires.squire: Due to the condition of the Ms., the structure of the quires cannot be established.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking is mostly visible; ruling is partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is usually written above the ruling (frequently also below the ruling, cp. fols. 96-99, 108-111, 115, 116, etc.) The bottom line is written above the ruling. A few bottom ruling lines are not used in some fols., e.g. fol. 4r. The columns (and margins) are frequently of irregular size; the scribes (esp. hand a) frequently disregarded the ruling; columns are frequently of somewhat irregular size.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: poor. Hands b, c: careful.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 1ra-30vb, 32ra-33vb, 35ra-42va, 164ra-165vb. Hand b: fols. 43ra-162vb. Hand c: fols. 31r-v, 34r-v, 42vb. Hand c corrected and made addition to Text I-1 and I-2 written in hand a: e.g. on fols. 41va, 41vb, 42vb.

rubrications.rubrication: Incipit of Text I and its sections; number, title and incipit of canons; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals. On the incipit page of Text I and of its sections, a few lines are rubricated (alternating with black lines).

colophon.det: Written in a secondary hand, partly readable. The note states that Sәmʿon, qesä gäbäz of the church Betä Ḥawaryat, donated the book to the church of the 12 Apostles.

additional.det: Written in a more recent hand, 17th or 18th cent. (?)

extras.extra: - The title ሲኖዶስ is written on the front board. - Use of compressed script: fols. 31rv, 34rv, 42vb, 116rb-117vb. - The text is written over extensive erasure: fol. 40v, 42vb (canon of the biblical books?). - Cues for the rubricator (numerals, written sometimes in tiny size and thin strokes, but sometimes in regular size): fols. 63-66va, 95v, 159r-160r. - Small crosses mostly of simple form, sometimes of sophisticated form, or tiny lines separating the words, might indicate the process of correction or preparation for inserting text dividers: fols. 139v, 140r, 147v. - Some parchment leaves are produced rather crudely.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - A piece of thread is inserted in the upper corner of fol. 96.
